title: Famous Women for National Women's History Month
article:
Rosa Parks:
Rosa Parks, a female civil rights activist, advocated for colored people’s rights by refusing to give up her seat on a bus. She was sitting at the front of the bus and a white man came in front of her. Rosa was told to leave her seat so the white man could sit, but she refused. She soon got arrested for her actions, but nowadays she is seen as a hero because she influenced more blacks to stand up for their rights..

Frida Kahlo:
Frida Kahlo, a great artist, wasn’t always known for her talent. As a child, Frida had very poor health. At the age of 6, she contracted polio in her legs. After that, she had to simply sit in her bed and do nothing. She soon recovered from polio and was left with a limp. When she was an adult, Frida was involved in an accident which affected her pelvis, spine, and her hip. Soon after, her interests went into art. She developed a great talent. She passed away on July 13, 1957. Despite her passing, she is still well-known for her artistry.

Ada Lovelace:
Ada Lovelace was born in 1815 and died in 1852. She liked to design machines. Such as, boats and steam flying machines! She is also known as the world’s first computer programmer because even though the computer was never built, she wrote about them and discovered that the computer could follow simple instructions,and program it to perform a complicated calculation.
author: Noa Kamil
